request_pathways.name: Mail completed Form 7033 to 301 University Blvd., Galveston, TX 77555-0782

forms.document_type: Third-party HIPAA authorization form (Form 7032, Rev. 10/16, outdated third-party copy)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: UTMB provides a dedicated patient self-request form (Form 7033) with email, fax, mail submission and MyChart/email/fax/mail delivery options, plus a Datavant/Swellbox online portal alternative.

red_flags: Bundled sensitive-information consent (mental health, substance abuse, HIV/AIDS) with no opt-out for individual categories
Outdated Form 7032 hosted by third-party vendor (Champion Records Service) with no cross-reference to the correct patient form
bright_spots: Dedicated patient self-request form (Form 7033) separate from third-party authorization (Form 7032)
Four delivery options including MyChart Patient Portal and email
Email submission of completed form (himrio@utmb.edu) eliminates need for printer or fax
Transparent plain-language email encryption risk disclosure
Datavant/Swellbox online portal as digital alternative

findability.rationale: Level 4: Easy to find with basic navigation — one search surfaced the medical records page, which lists forms clearly; SharePoint hosting adds minor download friction but does not affect patient browser experience.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: Usable digitally with workarounds; fax/email submission available — form has a text layer but zero fillable fields, requiring print-and-handwrite or PDF annotation; electronic submission via email or fax is available.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized with minor clarity or length issues — compact one-page form with logical flow and multiple delivery options; missing fee info, turnaround time, and patient rights statement are minor gaps.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 4: Patient access clearly accommodated — UTMB maintains a dedicated patient form (7033) separate from third-party auth (7032) with MyChart/email delivery, though it lacks a patient rights statement and has bundled sensitive-info consent.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: Minor ambiguities but nothing materially impeding — no unnecessary barriers (no notarization, no in-person requirement), voluntary and non-conditioning language present; bundled sensitive consent and missing fee disclosure are minor issues.

overall.summary: UTMB demonstrates above-average patient-centeredness with a dedicated self-request form, multiple submission/delivery options, and a Datavant/Swellbox portal alternative, but is held back by non-fillable PDF fields, missing fee/rights/turnaround information, and no multilingual support.
